message:
In an unexpected but pleasant turn of events, one of India's finest stand-up comedians, Zakir Khan, had come to the IIT Kharagpur campus. His show had been one of the highlights of Kshitij 2017. 

Watch him grappling for words to express his feelings, as he relives his experience at Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur but in the end, he manages to do it in the way only he can.

#Zakir_on_KTJ
#Kshitij_fad_hai

A teacher takes a hand, opens a mind and touches a heart. 
Teachers aren't restricted to the people imparting education in the classrooms. There are a lot of things around us that have influenced our outlook, and helped us grow as a person. 
This Teacher's Day, Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur urges everyone to reflect on their parents, friends, acquaintances or even the thoughts and experiences, all of whom have shaped their formative years, and have played the role of a teacher in ways more than one.
Wish you all a very happy Teacher's Day.

Hello everyone, here's your chance to be a part of Asia’s largest techno-management fest. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is reaching out to diligent individuals from every college to be a campus representative and work alongside us to enhance your time management, teamwork and leadership skills while having a breathtaking experience. 
Register at https://tinyurl.com/ktj2018-cr. Win incentives, concessions and certification from IIT Kharagpur.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone, Eid Mubarak!

May the magic of this Eid bring lots of happiness in your life. May you celebrate it with your near and dear ones and may it fill your heart with wonders. 

This Eid, let's take a pledge to respect the differences in each of us and live in peace and harmony.

IBM, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur, will be conducting a Tech Talk on Business Analytics and Business Computing at the S.N.Bose Auditorium (Main Building) on 1st September, from 6 PM onwards.

You can register at www.tinyurl.com/ibmworkshop2018.

story: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur shared their photo.
message: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur shared their photo. Greetings, Freshers! Fortune has come to embrace you with another opportunity. Get ready to demonstrate your grit and determination. Kshitij cordially invites both UG and PG first years to experience the amaze of this technological and managerial journey. So, fuel your enthusiasm and join us to flourish the 15th edition of Kshitij. Register at http://tinyurl.com/KCASelections

story: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
IBM, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur will be conducting a Tech Talk at the S.N.Bose Auditorium (Main Building) on 1st September, from 6 PM onwards.

You can register at www.tinyurl.com/ibmworkshop2018.

Talk 1: Business Analytics by Mr. Sumanta K. Adhikari, Senior Data Scientist at IBM
Talk 2: Business Computing by Mr. Joydeep Banerjee, Global PM&T Lead (EA-Microsoft) at IBM

Ahoy Freshers!

The time has come to witness the grandeur of yet another facet of the technosapien cosmos. So, hop on, sit back and construe as we delve deeper into this exhilarating spirit of Asia's largest techno-management fest.

Be there at Kalidas Auditorium on 27th August (Sunday) at 6 PM. Surprises await you!

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a very happy Ganesh Chaturthi. 
While the elders rejoice by embellishing the Ganesh idols in their homes, the younger ones are more inclined towards conspiring to get that extra ‘modak’ inconspicuously. 
Let's celebrate this auspicious day together and revere the elephant-headed deity, who is touted to be the remover of all obstacles.

The late night bhaat sessions over a cup of hot tea, the food joints and canteens that are a lifeline for the 'gourmand', the 2.2 rounds, the incessant cramming before the exams and the subsequent collective groan at the unfortunate results, all have been a source of countless indelible memories for all KGPians.

This 18th August, Kshitij pays a heartwarming tribute to the place that has and will shape our future. Happy Birthday, KGP!

#hbdkgp

This 18th August, Kshitij pays a heartwarming tribute to the place that has and will shape our future. Happy Birthday, KGP!

#hbdkgp

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a happy Independence Day. 
Along with flag hoisting and conducting cultural programmes, let's also remember and respect the sacrifices made by the freedom fighters. Although we have achieved autonomy, yet we are to free our country from poverty, religious tensions and racism. 

This Independence Day, let's join our hands together and pledge to maintain the sanctity of this country for perpetuity. Let's play our part in nation-building and make India a manufacturing hub, thereby promoting Make In India. 

Design Credits: Shubham Kumar

The 14th edition of Asia's largest techno-management fest witnessed a confluence of tech-enthusiasts, eminent personalities from across the globe, and the latest developments in science and technology, under a single umbrella.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents its Official Aftermovie for the 2017 edition, which pays a heartwarming tribute to the indelible memories gained during the 3-day extravaganza.

The bond between siblings is unbreakable. The petty fights over trivial things only serve to make their relation stronger. In spite of the enormous geographical distances, Rakshabandhan provides yet another spark in this beautiful relationship.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur pays a tribute to this bond, and wishes everyone a very Happy Rakshabandhan.

Design Credits : Khushaal Jaiswal

Kshitij, the annual techno-management fest of IIT Kharagpur heartily welcomes you to one of the premier institutions of the country, as you embark on the life changing journey to finding yourself. 
The first few days might be intimidating, but we assure you that this experience is going to imbibe within you indelible memories and intimate friendships to last a lifetime. 
Do meander into the odd lanes, enrich yourself with new experiences and explore new avenues, while you pursue your true self.
#KTJ_2K18

Design Credits: Darshak Mehta

The entire world stands shattered with the demise of one of the most gifted contemporary artists of all time.  
This serves as a reality check for everyone and goes to show that depression is indeed very real. 
Our social initiative Astitva launched last year aimed to address the stigma around mental health. 
Although a person may seem jovial from outside, but one doesn't really know if they're facing issues in their lives. The best thing one can do is to reach out and pay heed to their silent cries for help, that often go unheard.

Rest in peace, Chester Bennington. You will be dearly missed.

Design Credits: Sambhrant Kumar Singh

#EIDMUBARAK
